thread.title: U.S. and Canadian Airlines: Phone Numbers and Websites
thread.title_full: U.S. and Canadian Airlines: Phone Numbers and Websites

author: Benet Wilson
title: U.S. and Canadian Airlines: Phone Numbers and Websites
text:
Need to find or get in touch with an airline? Below are links to websites and phone numbers where you can speak with a live human being, although it may cost you.
1. Air Canada Canada's flag carrier serves close to 35 million passengers annually and provides direct passenger service to more than 175 destinations on five continents.
888-247-2262 More »
2. Air Transat A Canadian airline based in Montreal, Quebec, operating scheduled and charter flights, serving 60 destinations in 25 countries.
866-847-1112 More »
3. AirTran Airways This Atlanta-based carrier is being absorbed by Southwest Airlines , which acquired it in 2011. The AirTran brand is expected to go away by the end of 2014.
800-247-8726 More »
4. Alaska Airlines Seattle-based carrier that serves 101 destinations with 833 daily departures in the United States, Mexico and Canada.
800-252-7522 More »
5. Allegiant Airlines Las Vegas-based carrier focused on linking travelers in small cities to world-class leisure destinations: Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Fort Myers / Punta Gorda, Fla., Honolulu, Hawaii, Las Vegas , Nev., Los Angeles, Calif., Maui, Hawaii, Myrtle Beach, S.C., Orlando / Sanford, Fla., Palm Springs, Calif., Phoenix / Mesa, Ariz., San Diego, Calif., San Francisco / Oakland, Calif., Tampa Bay / St. Pete., Fla.
702-505-8888 More »
6. American Airlines This Fort Worth, Texas-based carrier was merged with US Airways in 2013. While they still operate separately, the combined carrier operates an average of nearly 6,700 flights per day to 339 destinations in 54 countries from its hubs in Charlotte, Chicago, Dallas/Fort Worth, Los Angeles , Miami, New York, Philadelphia, Phoenix and Washington, D.C.
800-433-7300 More »
7. Cape Air The Barnstable, Mass.-based airline operates a fleet of 75 Cessna 402s, two ATR-42s and three Britten-Norman Islanders and flies more than 735,000 passengers annually with up to 550 flights per day to 44 destinations in its five regions, which represent both U.S. domestic andinternational markets.
800-227-3247 More »
8. Delta Air Lines The Atlanta-based carrier serves nearly 165 million customers a year. It offer service to 324 destinations in 59 countries on six continents and operates a mainline fleet of more than 700 aircraft.
800-221-1212 More »
9. Frontier Airlines A Denver-based carrier that offers ultra-low fares to more than 75 destinations in the United States, Mexico, Costa Rica , Jamaica and the Dominican Republic.
800-432-1359 More »
10. Great Lakes Airlines This Cheyenne, Wyo.-based airline offers scheduled passenger air service with a fleet of Embraer EMB-120 Brasilias and Beechcraft 1900D regional airliners.
800-554-5111 More »
